Description: Glazed steatite scarab, traces of green, brown and white glaze preserved; pierced longitudinally; engraved head and legs, on the base is the red crown of lower Egypt and an adjed pillar, neb signs above and below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 282)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 106)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P41, Pl IV)
Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (P. 165, No.2)
